intro: Chlorocyathus, commonly known as the green cup, is a genus of marine algae belonging to the family Halimodendron. These algae are found in shallow coastal waters, often attached to rocks or other substrates. Chlorocyathus species play a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to primary production and providing habitat for small organisms. Their simple structure and photosynthetic capabilities make them important in benthic communities.
